section.title: Credential Problems
section.para: GRAM requires a client certificate and private key in order authenticate with the GRAM service. If these are not available, the GRAM client will fail. In typical use, a user will create a temporary proxy certificate either derived from their identity certificate issued by some certificate authority, or from a service such as myproxy. If a GRAM client command returns any error containing the string GSS Major Status you've hit a credential problem. Look at the Troubleshooting Section of the GSI manual for details about how to diagnose and correct these errors. The grid-cert-diagnostics tool with the -p command-line option is especially helpful for diagnosing some of these types of problems.

section.title: Connection Failures
section.para:
There are three types of problems which can cause apparent connection failures: the service isn't running on the given resource name, it does not accept your credential for some reason, or you do not trust the service's credential.
In the former two case, please contact the administrator of the GRAM resource to determine the cause. The Troubleshooting section of the GRAM Admin Guide contains information about debugging these by checking that the service is running and be looking at the /var/log/globus-gatekeeper.log file.
